titleproper.value:
Guide to the Howe Family Photograph Collection
                    <lb/>circa 1890's-1900's
                    <lb/>
                    <num>PR 292</num>

author.value: Finding aid prepared by Susan Kriete

creation.value:
This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit
                <date>2012-12-12T16:35-0500</date>

abstract.label: Abstract
abstract.value: This collection consists of approximately 150 photographs (gelatin silver prints and cyanotypes) of members of the Howe family and their residences in the Bronx and in Hazleton, PA.

p.value: Photocopying undertaken by staff only. Limited to twenty exposures of stable, unbound material per day. (Researchers may not accrue unused copy amounts from previous days.)
This collection should be cited as: Howe Family Photograph Collection, PR 291, Department of Prints, Photographs, and Architectural Collections, The New-York Historical Society.
<emph render="italic">Special thanks to N-YHS librarian Joseph Ditta for his invaluable assistance in researching the Howe family</emph>.

Photographs of Hazleton, PA, include street views, shots of the homes where Alfred Howe's children were born, and interior shots of a local grocer. Also included are photographs of coal mining equipment, some of it designed and built by Frederick T. Howe.
